item.title: Michelle add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "The cure for boredom is curiosity. There is no cure for curiosity." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "I hate writing, I love having written." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "She runs the gamut of emotions from A to B." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Dorothy Parker
item.description: "Misfortune, and recited misfortune especially, can be prolonged to the point where it ceases to excite pity and arouses only irritation." -- Dorothy Parker

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am not young enough to know everything." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I don't want to go to heaven. None of my friends are there." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "The suspense is terrible. I hope it will last." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "Remember to always be yourself. Unless you suck." -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "All I ask is this: Do something. Try something. Speaking out, showing up, writing a letter, a check, a strongly worded e-mail. Pick a cause – there are few unworthy ones. And nudge yourself past the brink of tacit support to action. Once a month, once a year, or just once...Even just learning enough about a subject so you can speak against an opponent eloquently makes you an unusual personage. Start with that. Any one of you would have cried out, would have intervened, had you been in that crowd in Bashiqa. Well thanks to digital technology, you’re all in it now." -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "What I say is, a town isn't a town without a bookstore. It may call itself a town, but unless it's got a bookstore it knows it's not fooling a soul." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Most people don't realize how important librarians are. I ran across a book recently which suggested that the peace and prosperity of a culture was solely related to how many librarians it contained. Possibly a slight overstatement. But a culture that doesn't value its librarians doesn't value ideas and without ideas, well, where are we?" -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Neil Gaiman & Terry Pratchett
item.description: "An Angel who did not so much Fall as Saunter Vaguely Downwards." -- Neil Gaiman & Terry Pratchett

item.title: Michelle add a quote by David Sedaris
Michelle add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "We were not a hugging people. In terms of emotional comfort it was our belief that no amount of physical contact could match the healing powers of a well made cocktail." -- David Sedaris

item.title: Michelle add a quote by David Sedaris
item.description: "Certain motherfuckers think they can fuck with my shit, but you can't kill the Rooster. You might can fuck him up some times, but, bitch, nobody kills the motherfucking Rooster. You know what I'm saying?" -- David Sedaris

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Malcolm Gladwell
item.description: "The key to good decision making is not knowledge. It is understanding. We are swimming in the former. We are desperately lacking in the latter." -- Malcolm Gladwell

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Malcolm Gladwell
item.description: "Truly successful decision-making relies on a balance between deliberate and instinctive thinking." -- Malcolm Gladwell

item.title: Michelle add a quote by Pablo Picasso
item.description: "Art is the lie that enables us to realize the truth." -- Pablo Picasso
